title: Zee27
author: Zee27
content: Some exchanges are leveling up by enabling credit card purchases for cryptocurrencies and since there are quite a number of them with this possibility, which exchange do you recommend based on firsthand experience for easy purchase?

comments.author: Cryptoababe
comments.body: I know two exchanges.Thats Bitget and CEXio. But I would recommend Bitget cos thats the one I've used so far. Also, they support both VISA and Mastercard. And according to defillama.com, they have better transparency than CEXio.

comments.author: livingfree
comments.body: Quote from: Zee27 on September 20, 2023, 06:03:49 PMSome exchanges are leveling up by enabling credit card purchases for cryptocurrencies and since there are quite a number of them with this possibility, which exchange do you recommend based on firsthand experience for easy purchase? Binance.Everybody knows Binance, yes it's a centralized exchange and it has a lot of users. If you are going to use your credit card for purchasing crypto. They have their blogs on how to do it.This blog is just one of it: https://www.binance.com/en/blog/fiat/can-you-buy-cryptocurrency-with-a-credit-card-421499824684903691And if it is not enough, it's easy to google the process if there are some updates that happened.

comments.author: wallet4bitcoin
comments.body: I consider whatever has to do with my card details more than essential towards my identity. If for any reason I must share my details with an exchanger, then it must be a reliable exchanger that will have the mechanism to keep compromises away from their kyc database and for now, I consider only Binance fit for such.
